title: Tory Bruno: Amazon’s launch contracts a ‘big deal’ for U.S. and allies’ industrial competitiveness
summary: Tory Bruno said Amazon's launch contracts are not just significant for the winners but also for the industrial competitiveness of Western nations following Russia’s exit from the global launch market

title: NASA's Pioneering Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Awarded Collier Trophy
summary: The first aircraft to achieve powered, controlled flight on another planet has garnered an award whose past recipients make up a timeline of aerospace innovation and achievement.

title: Speedcast sees a dearth of satellite capacity ahead
summary: Demand for satellite communications has outstripped supply in markets recovering from the pandemic, according to satcoms provider Speedcast CEO Joe Spytek.

title: Amazon hails progress in driving down Project Kuiper antenna costs
summary: Amazon executive said the cost to produce antennas for its proposed Project Kuiper megaconstellation is already “well under $500,” even as SpaceX retreats from the subsidized $499 price it charges customers for its operational Starlink terminals.

title: Amazon chooses everyone but SpaceX to launch its Starlink competitor
summary: Amazon has announced a series of record-breaking launch contracts that will place a “majority” of its 3,236-satellite Project Kuiper constellation, which aims...

title: To counter threats, U.S. intelligence community leans on partners
summary: Partnerships with industry, academia and government agencies around the world are supporting the U.S. intelligence community’s campaign to counter threats to democracy like Russia's invasion of Ukraine, said Stacey Dixon, U.S. principal deputy director of national intelligence.

title: Amazon launch contracts drive changes to launch vehicle production
summary: United Launch Alliance is planning major production improvements for its Vulcan rocket while Arianespace will increase the performance of its Ariane 6 to meet the demands of their new Amazon contracts for Project Kuiper.

title: Space industry CEOs pledge to create more inclusive workforce
summary: Top executives from the space industry on April 5 signed a pledge to advance diversity across the workforce.

title: Raymond: 2023 budget proposal allows Space Force to ‘pivot’ to next-generation systems
summary: The U.S. Space Force cannot continue to acquire satellites and deploy constellations the same way it has in the past given the complexities to the current space environment, Gen. John “Jay” Raymond, said April 5.

title: Kendall: Space Force budget boost speaks to the value of space in defense strategy
summary: t a time when critical U.S. satellites are seen as likely targets for hostile attacks, adding billions of dollars to the Space Force’s budget was a necessary move, Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said April 5 in a keynote speech at the 37th Space Symposium.
